introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• The Pando colony in Utah is a single aspen grove that shares one giant underground root system.
• It is considered one of the largest living organisms by mass.
• Some estimates date this colony to be thousands of years old.
• Human activity and grazing animals threaten its continued growth.
• Conservation efforts focus on protecting new saplings and limiting overgrazing.
question: The student wants to emphasize why Pando is considered remarkable. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Human activity and grazing animals pose serious threats to Pando’s new saplings.
B: Because its aspen grove shares a single underground root system and may be thousands of years old, Pando is considered one of Earth’s largest and oldest organisms.
C: Conservation efforts are underway to prevent overgrazing of the aspen saplings in Pando.
D: Scientists have only recently discovered the age of the Pando colony.
explanation: Choice B highlights the two key reasons Pando is remarkable: it’s one massive interconnected root system and potentially thousands of years old.
